hackathon-description-text: The first FIT Space Hackathon focuses on the development of ideas and prototypes related to the training, health, and well-being of astronauts during spaceflight. This 24-hour event is held at FIT's Evans Library, with teams of student competitors having access to various VR/AR technologies to develop their ideas.
hackathon-requirements: code must be complete, no revisions after submission deadline

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: degree of completion, ability to demonstrate claimed features/functionality (MAX 15 POINTS)
soundness and feasibility of design (MAX 10 POINTS)
bonus points for additional factors (MAX 5 points)

hackathon-description-header: Create Solutions for spaceflight to MARS and beyond!!
